page.title: 12THE GHOST OF HUNSTANTON HALL
page.content: In the 18th century Hunstanton Hall was owned by Armine Styleman.She owned a persian carpet which was a present from the Shah.Her last words were that it remain in the family.It was packed away and forgotten,until someone who did not know of the request had the carpet cut up and distributed to the villagers.Armine's ghost then haunted the Hall with much ferocity until the carpet was restored to its former home Since then the ghost has kept a quiet watch to see that the same thing does not happen again.Similar stories with minor variations are told about other haunted houses in Britain. The Norfolk coast is a favourite haunt of Black Shuck.An enormous phantom hound with fiery eyes which vanishes with a clap of thunder. It is also seen in other parts of Britain under local names such as the Mauthie Dhoog.
